alerts.headline: severe thunderstorm watch in effect
alerts.description:
Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms that may be capable of producing strong wind gusts and large hail.

What:
Wind gusts of 90 km/h.
Hail up to 3 cm. 

When:
Continuing this evening. 

Additional information:
Thunderstorms over eastern Ontario may bring strong winds and hail to the area. These thunderstorms are expected to move east of the area late this evening.

###

Local utility outages are possible.

Strong wind gusts can damage trees, buildings and overturn vehicles.

Large hail can cause significant damage and injury.

Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms capable of producing damaging hail, wind or rain.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.

For more information: https://www.ontario.ca/page/be-prepared-emergency.
alerts.instruction:
When thunder roars, go indoors! Lightning kills and injures Canadians every year. Secure loose objects.

Emergency Management Ontario recommends that you take cover immediately if threatening weather approaches.

alerts.headline: severe thunderstorm watch ended

###

alerts.headline: squall warning in effect
alerts.description:
Squalls with wind gusts up to 35 knots, frequent lightning and hail up to 3 centimetres are expected or occurring in the area.

###

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. For more information monitor Canadian Coast Guard radio or Weatheradio stations.

alerts.headline: squall warning in effect
alerts.description:
Squalls with wind gusts up to 35 knots, frequent lightning and hail up to 3 centimetres are expected or occurring in the area.

Thunderstorms over southern portions of Lake Huron are moving east at 20 knots. Wind gusts near 35 knots are possible with these thunderstorms.

###

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. For more information monitor Canadian Coast Guard radio or Weatheradio stations.

###

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. For more information monitor Canadian Coast Guard radio or Weatheradio stations.

alerts.headline: squall watch in effect
alerts.description:
Conditions are favourable for the development of squalls with wind gusts up to 35 knots, frequent lightning and hail.

The potential for thunderstorm development will continue into this evening and possibly into the overnight hours.

alerts.headline: squall watch in effect
alerts.description:
Conditions are favourable for the development of squalls with wind gusts up to 35 knots, frequent lightning and hail.

The potential for thunderstorm development will continue into this evening.

###

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. For more information monitor Canadian Coast Guard radio or Weatheradio stations.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. For more information monitor Canadian Coast Guard radio or Weatheradio stations.

alerts.headline: squall warning in effect
alerts.description:
Squalls with wind gusts up to 35 knots, frequent lightning and hail of 1 to 2 centimetres are expected or occurring in the area.

Thunderstorms crossing Lake Erie are moving southeast at 20 knots. Wind gusts near 35 knots are possible with these thunderstorms.

###

Large hail can damage vessels and cause injury.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. For more information monitor Canadian Coast Guard radio or Weatheradio stations.
alerts.instruction: Vessels without lightning protection should make their way to shore immediately. Mariners are advised to prepare for squalls. If underway, seek safe harbour immediately. Take cover immediately, if threatening weather approaches. Consider delaying or postponing travel in areas under the squall warning.

alerts.headline: squall watch ended
alerts.description:
Squalls are no longer expected over the area.


###

###

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. For more information monitor Canadian Coast Guard radio or Weatheradio stations.
